title: Protocol for production and expression of chimeric bovine-human monoclonal antibodies
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Processing and storage of bovine PBMC
Timing: 2–6 h (for steps 1 to 16)
This step describes a workflow for processing and storage of bovine PBMC required for isolation of antigen specific B cells.
Collect blood (50–100 mL) from jugular vein of the cow using a butterfly cannula into blood bag containing citrate phosphate dextrose anticoagulant. Ship the blood samples at 20°C–25°C on the same-day or for 12–18 h courier to the processing lab.
Note: We were successful using blood draws made five days after a booster vaccination when memory B-cells are likely to be in peripheral circulation.
Note: Simultaneously blood without anticoagulants need to be collected to confirm the reactivity of serum against vaccine immunogen.
Dilute blood with 20°C–25°C DPBS-2 mM EDTA (1:1 v/v).
Add 20 mL Ficoll-Paque to an empty 50 mL conical centrifuge tube.
Carefully layer 30 mL of diluted blood onto Ficoll-Paque.
Note: Do not mix the blood and Ficoll- Paque media.
Note: Seven 50 mL conical centrifuge tube containing Ficoll-Paque (GE-Healthcare) is required if collecting 100 mL blood.
Centrifuge at 800 × g for 20 min at 20°C–25°C (brake: off; acceleration: slow).
Note: Set the centrifuge at 4°C after this step.
Using a sterile pipette, carefully discard the upper layer containing plasma and platelets. Do not disturb the white mononuclear cell layer.
Note: Diluted plasma in the upper layer can be stored and tested to determine the titre of antibodies against the target antigen. Antibodies can also be purified from diluted plasma if required.
Use a transfer pipette in a slow, circular motion to carefully suck up mononuclear cells (the white layer like a white cloud on top of Ficoll-Paque layer). Transfer the cells into an empty sterile 50 mL conical centrifuge tube.

Add at least 2 volumes of cold DPBS-2 mM EDTA (4°C–8°C) to the transferred mononuclear cells.
Resuspend the cells gently and horizontally centrifuge at 325 × g for 8 min at 4°C (brake: off; acceleration: slow).
Note: If it is important to get rid of platelets, centrifuge the cells at low speed (100–200 × g) for 10 min at 4°C.
Discard the supernatant and resuspend the mononuclear cells in 2 mL cold DPBS-2 mM EDTA and pool the cells from 50 mL conical centrifuge tubes into one 50 mL centrifuge tube. Fill to top with cold DPBS-2 mM EDTA.
Horizontally centrifuge at 150 × g for 8 min at 4°C (brake: off; acceleration: slow). Discard the supernatant.
Resuspend the cells in 3–4 mL 0.83% ammonium chloride and incubate for 5 min on ice.
Wash the cells with 20 mL cold DPBS-2 mM EDTA and centrifuge at 150 × g for 8 min at 4°C (brake: on; acceleration: high).
Discard the supernatant and repeat the wash step two more times. Resuspend the cells in cold DPBS-2 mM EDTA and count the cells.
Centrifuge at 150 × g for 8 min at 4°C (brake: on; acceleration: high).
Discard the supernatant and resuspend the cells in freezing media containing 90% horse serum (Sigma Aldrich) and 10% dimethylsulfoxide (DMSO).
Note: Freeze 10–20 million cells per 1 mL freezing media.
Note: Label the microtubes before aliquoting the cells as it is not recommended to keep the cell in cryopreservation medium at 20°C–25°C. Place the cryovials in the freezing container and store them at −80°C for 24 h (for long-term storage, transfer the vials to liquid nitrogen).
Staining and sorting of antigen-specific B cells
Timing: ∼ 6 h (for steps 17 to 43)

The protocol for staining and sorting of cells needs to be designed and tested in advance according to the user’s experimental needs. To clarify the strategy, we describe using a panel of antibodies to sort HIV-1 envelope (Env)-specific B cells in this step.
Biotinylation of HIV-1 Env probe
Add 0.15 nmol of Avi-tagged HIV-1 AD8 SOSIP v4.1 Env (130 kDa; 20 μL from 1 mg/mL stock) to one sterile 1.5 mL microtube.
Note: AD8 SOSIP is a native like stabilized cleavable version of Env.1[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib1] Avi-tag is an extra 15 amino acid sequence that can be fused to the N- or the C-terminus of protein (C-terminus in this study). BirA ligase enzymatically attaches one biotin molecule to Avi-tag.
Critical: HIV-1 Env need to be in Bicine 50 mM buffer for efficient biotinylation. Change the buffer before this step if it is required.
Add 0.5 μg (1.19 μL from 0.42 mg/mL stock) of BirA enzyme from BirA Biotin-Protein Ligase Kit (Avidity) to microtube.
Note: 2.5 μg of BirA enzyme is required per 10 n mol protein in 40 μM final volume).
Add 3 μL Biomix A and 3 μL Biomix B from BirA Biotin-Protein Ligase Kit (Avidity) to the microtube.
Adjust the final reaction volume to 30 μL with ddH2O (2.81 μL).
Incubate the reaction at 30°C for 40 min.
Change the buffer to DPBS using 50 kDa Amicon Ultra centrifugal filter units according to the manufacturer’s instruction.
Note: Adjust the final volume to 20–100 μL (final concentration 0.2–1 mg/mL).
Critical: Efficient biotinylation and retained antigen activity must be confirmed according to the user’s experimental needs before fluorescent labelling. Biotinylation can be checked in ELISA assay by coating the wells with biotinylated Env then detecting the biotin with streptavidin-HRP. Antigenicity and the presence of epitopes can be tested using different antibodies.

Fluorescent labelling of sorting probe
Couple HIV-1 Env to streptavidin-APC and streptavidin-PE (Thermo Fisher Scientific) separately in equimolar ratios as following:
Note: If double staining is not required, coupling can be limited to APC as a very bright fluorochrome with minimal spectral overlap with Alexa-488-IgG.
Add 5.54 μL Streptavidin-PE to sterile 1.5 mL microtube containing 6.46 μL DPBS (Gibco). Mix it well and cover the microtube with aluminium foil to protect from light. Keep the microtube on ice.
Add 4.10 μL Streptavidin-APC to another sterile 1.5 mL microtube containing 7.90 μL DPBS (Gibco). Mix it well and cover the microtube with aluminium foil to protect from light. Keep the microtube on ice.
In two separate microtube, add 8 μg (1 mg/mL) HIV-1 Env AD8 SOSIP v4.1 and label them as PE and APC, respectively.
Add 2.4 μL Streptavidin-PE/DPBS mixture to microtube PE, cover the microtube with aluminium foil to protect from light and incubate for 15 min on ice while shaking (or use a rotary shaker at 4°C).
Repeat step 26, four more time (each time 2.4 μL) to add all Streptavidin-PE/DPBS mixture to HIV-1 Env probe.
Note: Keep the microtube at 4°C until use for maximum 24 h.
Repeat step 22 for APC microtube using Streptavidin-APC/DPBS mixture.
Staining and fluorescence-activated cell (FACS) sorting of antigen-specific bovine B cells
This step can be performed by both cryopreserved or freshly isolated PBMC. If using cryopreserved PBMCs, start with step 29 and if using freshly isolated PBMCs, start with step 37.
Thaw 2–3 million cryopreserved PBMCs in 37°C water batch until there is just a small bit of ice left in the vial.
Add 500 μL pre-warmed 37°C RPMI 1640 medium (Life technologies) (containing 10% FBS, 20 μg/mL or 10 U/mL RQ1 RNase -free DNaseI (Promega)) dropwise. Resuspend the cells.

Transfer the cells to one sterile 10 mL conical centrifuge tube and add 9.5 mL pre-warmed RPMI (as above) slowly. Incubate for 5 min at RT.
Filter the cells through a 40-μm cell strainer to remove clumps followed by horizontal centrifugation at 200 × g for 10 min at 4°C.
Discard the supernatant and resuspend the cells in 6 mL cold DPBS-2 mM EDTA-1% horse serum.
Add 4 mL Ficoll-Paque to one sterile 10 mL conical centrifuge tube. Layer the cells onto the Ficoll-Paque and centrifuge at 500 × g for 20 min at 4°C (brake: off; acceleration: slow).
Critical: This step removes the dead cells which improves the efficiency of staining.
Collect the white layer on top of Ficoll-Paque and transfer to one sterile 10 mL conical centrifuge tube. Add 9 mL cold DPBS-2 mM EDTA-1% horse serum.
Centrifuge at 500 × g for 10 min at 4°C (brake: on; acceleration: high) and discard the supernatant.
Resuspend the cells in 157.9 μL cold DPBS-2 mM EDTA and transfer them to one sterile 5 mL FACS tube.
Add 0.1 μL LIVE/DEAD™ Fixable Aqua Dead Cell Stain (Thermo Fisher Scientific) and incubate the cells on ice for 10–15 min.
Add 20 μL HIV-1 Env-PE, 20 μL HIV-1 Env-APC and 2 μL Alexa-fluor 488 conjugated anti-bovine IgG (Sigma, B6901). Incubate the cells for 1 h on ice (on a rocking mixer).
Note: anti-bovine IgG (clone B6901) is in unconjugated format and need to be conjugated to Alexa-fluor 488 before the staining.
Add 4 mL DPBS containing 1 mM EDTA and 1% horse serum (Sigma) and centrifuge at 500 × g for 10 min.
Resuspend the cells in 200–500 μL DPBS-2 mM EDTA-1% horse serum and filter through a 40-μm cell strainer to remove clumps.

Gate (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]) and sort single cells (live/ IgG+/ HIV Env-PE+/HIV Env-APC+) into 96-well plates containing lysis buffer (3.7 μL/well DPBS, 10 mM DTT and 8 U RNasin Ribonuclease Inhibitor (Promega)) on an ARIA III sorter using BD FACSDiva Software.
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2247-Fig1.jpg
Figure 1. FACS sorting gating strategy of HIV-1 specific bovine B cells
Cow PBMCs are sorted for live IgG+ cells that bind to biotinylated AD8 SOSIP-AviTag conjugated to PE and APC fluorophores.
Note: Frequency of IgG+ cells can be 5%–20% of live cells.
Once the sorting is finalised, cover the plate with adhesive PCR plate seals, centrifuge it at 1,000 × g for 30 s and store the plate at −80°C immediately.
Pause point: The plate is stable at −80°C for a few months. If the plate is immediately flash frozen on dry ice, it can be stored at −80°C for even several years.
Critical: The plate can’t be proceeded to next step without the cold shock or storage at −80°C. This step is required to rupture the cell membranes.
Reverse transcription and nested RT-PCR
Timing: ∼ 11 h (for steps 44 to 62)
This step describes the steps required for cDNA synthesis from bovine single B cells and amplification of variable genes in nested RT-PCR.
Critical: Decontaminate the hood, bench surface, pipettes prior to use with RNaseZap (Thermo Fisher Scientific) to avoid any possible contamination. Use RNase-free precautions for this step.
cDNA synthesis
Thaw the plate of single cells on ice for 5 min.
Prepare the reverse transcription master mix on ice.
Note: Prepare dNTP (10 mM final concentration for each deoxynucleoside triphosphate) by mixing stock of dATP, dTTP, dCTP, and dGTP solutions at 1:1:1:1 (Promega) ratio. Aliquot and store them at −20°C. Alternatively, can use premixed dNTP available from Invitrogen or other providers.

Carefully add 15 μL of the master mix to each well, mix.
Cover the plate with adhesive PCR plate seals.
Centrifuge the plate 1,000 × g for 30 s and use the reverse transcription program.

Prepare PCR1 master mix.

Label a plate as PCR1 and add 20 μL of PCR 1 master mix to each well.

Thaw cDNA plate on ice for 5 min then centrifuge at 1,000 × g for 30 s.
Add 5 μL cDNA (one fourth of reverse transcription product) to PCR1 plate.
Note: one tenth to one fourth of reverse transcription product can be used in PCR1.
Cover the plate with adhesive PCR plate seals.
Centrifuge the plate 1,000 × g for 30 s place the plate in thermocycler and run PCR1 program.

Cloning of VH and VL genes into expression vectors
Timing: ∼ 3–4 days (For steps 63 to 109)
This step describes step-by-step detail on cloning of bovine variable genes into human expression vectors which results in IgG1 chimeric bovine mAbs with human constant regions.
Purification and digestion of PCR2 product
Follow the protocol for NucleoSpin Gel and PCR Clean-up kit (Scientifix, #740609.250) to purify 45 μL of PCR2 product.
Note: elute PCR2 product in 20 μL Nuclease-free H2O.
Pause point: If not using the purified PCR2 product immediately, store it at 4°C (stable for a few days) or −20°C and −80°C (stable for 3 years).
Note: In this protocol PCR2 is not sequenced. Sequencing is performed on heavy and light expression plasmids after confirming the antigen specificity of mAbs in ELISA.
Digest purified PCR2 product as below.
table:files/protocols_protocol_2247_7.csv
Incubate for 2 h at 37°C.
Follow the protocol for NucleoSpin Gel and PCR Clean-up kit (Scientifix, #740609.250).
Note: Elute digested PCR2 product in 20 μL Nuclease-free H2O.

Pause point: If not using the PCR2 product immediately, store it at 4°C (stable for a few days) or −20°C (stable for a few month).
Linearization of expression vector
Expression vectors contain human heavy (IgG1) and light (lambda) constant regions.
Thaw IgG1 (pFUSEssCHIg-hG1, Invivogen) and lambda (pFUSE2ss-CLIg-hL2, Invivogen) expression vectors at 20°C–25°C.
Digest expression vectors as below.

Incubate for 2 h at 37°C.
Add 5.5 μL Antarctic Phosphatase reaction buffer and 10 μL Antarctic Phosphatase.
Incubate for 1 h at 37°C.
Prepare 1% (wt/vol) agarose gel.
Load the whole volume of each digestion mix and 7 μL of 1 kb plus ladder into separate gel wells.
Run the gel at 100 V for 1 h in 1× TAE buffer.
Expose the gel to UV light and cut out the linearized vector with scalpel (Figure 4[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig4]).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2247-Fig4.jpg
Figure 4. Linearization of expression vectors
pFUSE2ss-CLIg-hL2 (light) and pFUSEssCHIg-hG1 (heavy) expression vectors containing human antibody constant genes are digested and linearized with EcoRI-HF/AvrII and EcoRI-HF/NheI-HF, respectively. The linearized vectors are dephosphorylated and run on 1% gel to cut out a band of 3,837 bp and 4,481 bp for pFUSE2ss-CLIg-hL2 and pFUSEssCHIg-hG1, respectively.
Note: The size of linearized pFUSE2ss-CLIg-hL2 vector is 3,837 bp and linearized pFUSEssCHIg-hG1 vector is 4,481 bp.
Critical: Reduce the exposure time to UV light to minimise DNA damage and use new scalpel for each vector to prevent cross-contamination.
Follow the protocol for NucleoSpin Gel and PCR Clean-up kit (Scientifix, #740609.250). The expected yield of linearized vector after gel extraction and purification is 2–3 μg.
Note: Elute the digested linearized vector in 100–200 μL Nuclease-free H2O.
Pause point: Make a few aliquots from the digested linearized vector and store them at −20°C (stable for 3 years). Avoid repeated freeze-thaw cycles.

Adjust the concentration of linearized vector to 50–100 ng/ μL with Nuclease-free H2O.
Ligation of digested VH/VL genes & transformation
Remove the T4 DNA ligase buffer (Thermo Fisher Scientific) from −20°C and thaw it at 20°C–25°C.
Remove purified digested PCR2 product and digested purified linearized expression vectors from −20°C and thaw them on ice.
Note: Remove T4 DNA ligase (Thermo Fisher Scientific) from −20°C and keep it on ice, just immediately before adding it to the ligation mix.
Prepare the ligation mix for each individual PCR2 product.
Note: Ligation mix for heavy and light gene must be prepared in separate microtubes.
Note: A ligation control can must be included with vector only (no purified digested PCR2 product). This control verifies that the vector is digested completely and whether the phosphatase treatment worked properly.

Incubate the ligation reaction at 20°C–25°C for 12–18 h.
Remove Top10 E. Coli chemically competent cells from −80°C and thaw them on ice.
Add 40 μL Top10 competent cells to the ligation reaction and keep it on ice for 30 min.
Set the water bath to 42°C.
Incubate the ligation reaction at 42°C for 45–60 s and place it on ice immediately.
Incubate on ice for 5 min.
Add 100 μL of SOC medium to each reaction and incubate on a bacterial shaker at 37°C and 180 rpm for 1 h.
Meantime, label Zeocin agar plate for heavy chain reactions and Blacticidin LB-agar plate for light chain reactions. Prewarm the agar plate at 37°C.
After incubation (step 87), centrifuge the samples briefly to collect the evaporated medium.
Transfer the whole volume of each sample on the corresponding plate and spread the cells smoothly using bacterial spreader.
Incubate the plates at 37°C for 12–18 h.

Pause point: LB-agar plate can be sealed with parafilm and store at 4°C for up to 1 month after step.
Colony PCR and sequencing
Colony PCR is performed to verify the ligation of insert and sequencing confirm the accuracy of cloning.
Remove agar plates from the incubator or fridge.
Critical: Vector only plate must have lower colonies compared to the sample plates.
Prepare 10 mL conical centrifuge tubes containing 100 μL Zeocin or Blacticidin LB-broth for heavy chain and light chain plates, respectively.
Prepare colony PCR mix, transfer 20 μL to each well of PCR 96-well plate, and keep it on ice.

Note: Primers for colony PCR of heavy variable genes are Odp 3668 (Forward) Odp 2568 (Reverse). Primers for colony PCR of light variable genes are Odp 2571 (Forward) Odp 3677 (Reverse).
Clean pipette and bench surface with 70% ethanol.
With a sterile pipette tip, pick a single bacterial colony from the plate and transfer it to the colony PCR plate.
Eject the same tip to the corresponding 10 mL conical tube containing LB-broth Zeocin or Blacticidin.
Note: Pick 3 colonies from each plate and transfer them into separate colony PCR reactions and liquid culture.
Repeat this step for all agar plate.
Keep the liquid culture tubes at 20°C–25°C or 4°C until verifying the clones in colony PCR.
Centrifuge the colony PCR plate briefly, put it in the thermocycler and run colony PCR program.

Run the gel at 120 V for 30–45 min in 1× TAE buffer.

Expose the gel to UV light. The expected product for VH is ∼350–500 bp and for VL is ∼350.
For each pair of correct heavy and light chains, add 3 mL Zeocin LB-broth (heavy chain) or Blacticidin LB-broth (light chain) to the liquid cultures/
Incubate liquid culture tubes at 37°C for 12–18 h.
Follow the protocol for NucleoSpin Plasmid kit (Scientifix, #740588.250) to purify DNA plasmids 2 mL of liquid culture.
Note: Elute DNA plasmid in 50 μL Nuclease-free H2O.
Pause point: If not using DNA plasmid immediately, store it at −20°C (stable for 3 years).
Send DNA plasmid to sequencing using Odp 2781 sequencing primer (CTCAACTCTACGTCTTTGTTTC) to confirm the accuracy of cloning.
Use IMGT/V-QUEST (http://www.imgt.org/IMGT_vquest/vquest[href=http://www.imgt.org/IMGT_vquest/vquest])5[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib5],6[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib6] or IGBLAST (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/igblast/[href=https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/igblast/])4[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib4] tools to analyze the heavy and lambda light chains.
Expression of bovine-human chimeric mAbs
Timing: 5–10 days (for steps 110 to 149)
This step described the details of chimeric mAbs expression and performing functional assays to confirm the activity of HIV-1 specific chimeric mAbs.
Small-scale transfection of Expi293F cells
Transfection of mAb plasmids can be conducted in 12-well (3.8 cm2) to confirm the expression of mAb chains and to evaluate the function of chimeric mAb.
Critical: Decontaminate the hood, bench surface and pipettes with 70% ethanol prior to use to avoid any possible contamination.
Use Expi293F cells (Thermo Fisher Scientific) and prepare transfection mix with Expifectamine 293 Transfection kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific, #A14525) in Opti-MEM (Gibco) media.
Note: Using Opti-MEM medium prevents cell culture from overgrowth.
table:files/protocols_protocol_2247_12.csv
∗Expifectamine.
Dilute 2 μg DNA plasmids (1,200 ng light chain DNA plasmid and 800 ng heavy chain DNA plasmid) in 100 μL prewarmed Opti-MEM. Incubate at 20°C–25°C for 5 min.
Dilute 5.5 μL Expifectamine in 100 μL prewarmed Opti-MEM.
Add diluted Expifectamine to diluted DNA and mix it.

Incubate the transfection mix at 20°C–25°C for 20–30 min.
Meantime, prepare 5 × 106 cells in 1.7 mL prewarmed Opti-MEM.
Critical: Cell viability should be ≥95%.
Add the transfection mix to the cells slowly and swirl gently during addition.
Incubate the flask on an orbital shaker (100–130 rpm) with 8% CO2 at 37°C for 18–22 h.
Add 10 μL enhancer 1 and 100 μL enhancer 2 to the cells and swirl gently.
Note: There is no need to prewarm enhance 1 and enhancer 2.
Harvest the supernatant 5 days post-transfection (4 days after adding enhancers).
Spin the harvested supernatant at 500 × g for 5 min and transfer the clear supernatant to a clean microtube to be tested in western blot and ELISA.

Pause point: If not testing the supernatant, it can be stored at 4°C (stable for a few weeks).
Note: Supernatant can be tested in western blot to confirm the expression of both heavy and light chain (Figure 5[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig5]).
Functional assay
ELISA or functional assays can be performed to evaluate the activity of chimeric mAbs before large-scale production. The below protocol if for evaluation of anti-HIV chimeric mAbs.
Dilute D7324 Sheep anti-gp120 antibody (Aalto Bio Reagents) in DPBS to make the final concentration of 2 μg/mL.
Coat polystyrene microtiter ELISA plate with 100 μL of the diluted D7 324 Sheep anti-gp120 antibody and incubate the plate at 4°C for 12–18 h.
Note: Alternatively, plate can be coated with the diluted D7 324 Sheep anti-gp120 antibody and incubated at 37°C for 2 h.
Note: pH of DPBS as coating buffer must be 7.2–7.4.

Wash the plate 4 times with DPBST (DPBS containing 0.1% Tween-20) and 2 times DPBS.
Block the plate with 200 μL of 5% skim milk (in DPBST) for 1 h at 20°C–25°C. Then wash the plate as step 123.
Dilute D7324 tagged- AD8 SOSIP gp140. V4.1 in 5% skim milk to make the final concentration of 600 ng/mL and add 100 μL to each well.
Incubate the plate for 1 h at 20°C–25°C and afterwards wash the plate as step 123.
Add 100 μL from serial dilutions of harvested supernatant to the plate and incubate for 2 h at 20°C–25°C.
Note: Supernatant must be diluted with DPBS (at least 1:1 ratio) to reduce the background and false positive signal.
Meantime, prepare 1/1000 dilution of goat anti-human IgG HRP (KPL) and pre-incubate with 2% normal sheep serum for 2 h at 20°C–25°C.
Wash the plate as step 123 and add 100 μL of diluted goat anti-human IgG HRP.
Incubate the plate for 1 h at 20°C–25°C then wash the plate as step 123.
Add 100 μL of SureBlue TMB Peroxidase Substrate (KPL) and incubate the plate for 1 h at 20°C–25°C.
Stop the reaction using 100 μL of 2 M sulfuric acid.
Measure the absorbance at 450 nm against a reference of 690 nm using an ELISA plate reader.
Note: Sample is considered positive if optical density is at least 2 times greater than optical density of negative control.
Large-scale transfection of Expi293F cells
Transfection of mAb plasmids can be conducted in 125 mL Erlenmeyer flask with vent cap.
Critical: Decontaminate the hood, bench surface and pipettes with 70% ethanol prior to use to avoid any possible contamination.
Prepare the transfection mix as below:

Note: Prepare Midiprep from the expression vectors by using NucleoBond Xtra Midi kit if they are not enough for transfection.

∗Expifectamine.
Dilute 25 μg DNA plasmids (15 μg light chain DNA plasmid and 10 μg heavy chain DNA plasmid) in 1.5 mL prewarmed Opti-MEM. Incubate at 20°C–25°C for 5 min.
Dilute 80 μL Expifectamine in 1.4 mL prewarmed Opti-MEM.
Add diluted Expifectamine to diluted DNA and mix it.
Incubate the transfection mix at 20°C–25°C for 20–30 min.
Meantime, prepare 75 × 106 cells in 25 mL prewarmed Opti-MEM.
Critical: Cell viability should be ≥95%.
Add the transfection mix to the cells slowly and swirl the culture flask gently during addition.
Incubate the flask on an orbital shaker (100–130 rpm) with 8% CO2 at 37°C for 18–22 h.
Add 150 μL enhancer 1, and 1.5 mL enhancer 2 to the flask and swirl the flask gently.
Note: There is no need to prewarm enhance 1 and enhancer 2.
Harvest the supernatant 5 days post-transfection (4 days after adding enhancers).
Spin the harvested supernatant at 500 × g for 5 min and transfer the clear supernatant to a clean microtube.
Again, spin the supernatant at 3,000–4,000 × g for 10–15 min to remove the debris.
Transfer the supernatant into a sterile 50 mL conical tube.
Pause point: The supernatant can be kept at 4°C (several days). It is recommended to add Sodium Azide (0.02%–0.05%) to prevent bacterial growth if the supernatant is stored for a longer time.
Purification of chimeric mAb
Equilibrate poly-prep chromatography columns and add 1 mL Protein G agarose (50% slurry) to the column and purify the mAbs according to the manufacturer’s instructions (https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/20398[href=https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/20398]).
Elute the mAbs with 10 mL Glycine (50 mM, pH: 2.7) and neutralize low pH with 300 μL Tris (1 M, pH: 8.5).

Note: It is recommended to do buffer exchange with DPBS 1× using 50K Amicon centrifugal filters (Merck).
The chimeric mAb productivity can be determined by measurement with nanodrop. The presence of heavy and light chains is confirmed in western blot and quantified using ImageJ.7[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib7]
Pause point: The purified mAbs (in DPBS buffer) can be stored at −80°C for a couple of years.
